headline: Jim Cramer Notes Worday Stock Has Fallen Significantly From Its Highs
summary: Workday, Inc. (NASDAQ:WDAY) is one of the software stocks that Jim Cramer named as potential undervalued buys. Cramer highlighted the company’s valuation and its expected growth rate, as he commented: Then there’s Workday, you’ve seen them on our show a lot. It makes software for human capital management and corporate finance. It’s a name-brand company. […]

headline: Down 25.7% in 4 Weeks, Here's Why You Should You Buy the Dip in Workday (WDAY)
summary: Workday (WDAY) has become technically an oversold stock now, which implies exhaustion of the heavy selling pressure on it. This, combined with strong agreement among Wall Street analysts in revising earnings estimates higher, indicates a potential trend reversal for the stock in the near term.

headline: HR Path Strengthens Global Presence with the Strategic Acquisition of Lumi
summary: HR Path, a global leader in HR consulting and HRIS solutions, is proud to announce the strategic acquisition of Lumi, a US-based company specializing in Workday integrations.

headline: PageUp Clinch Completes Workday Design Approved Badge Integration
summary: Workday and PageUp Clinch integration streamlines connection between core platform HRIS and recruitment marketing, allowing Workday customers to create and manage talent pipelines at scaleNEW YORK, Feb. 10, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- PageUp, a global leader in talent acquisition software, today announced it has expanded its Workday integration and gained Design Approved Badge status. headline: High Growth Tech Stocks In US With Promising Potential
summary: As February begins, major U.S. stock indexes have surged, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average rising by 515 points and the S&P 500 nearing a record high, reflecting positive market sentiment despite recent economic uncertainties such as delayed jobs data due to a government shutdown. In this environment of heightened optimism and volatility, identifying high growth tech stocks with promising potential requires focusing on companies that demonstrate strong innovation capabilities and...

headline: Workday Brings Back Aneel Bhusri As CEO To Steer AI Focus
summary: Aneel Bhusri, Workday co founder and former executive chair, has returned as CEO following Carl Eschenbach's immediate resignation. Eschenbach will remain in an advisory role, highlighting the significance of the leadership transition. The company is framing Bhusri's return as central to its next phase of AI focused development. For investors tracking NasdaqGS:WDAY, this leadership change comes at a time when the shares are trading at $154.56, with a 1 year return of a 41.2% decline and a 5...
